thread.title_full: State of Alaska Department of Revenue Sells 1,133 Shares of Balchem Co. (NASDAQ:BCPC) - Defense World

author: Defense World Staff
title: State of Alaska Department of Revenue Sells 1,133 Shares of Balchem Co. (NASDAQ:BCPC) - Defense World
text: State of Alaska Department of Revenue reduced its position in Balchem Co. ( NASDAQ:BCPC – Free Report ) by 5.3% during the 3rd quarter, according to the company in its most recent 13F filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission. The firm owned 20,073 shares of the basic materials company’s stock after selling 1,133 shares during the quarter. State of Alaska Department of Revenue owned about 0.06% of Balchem worth $2,489,000 at the end of the most recent quarter. Several other hedge funds have also recently bought and sold shares of the company. Quantbot Technologies LP acquired a new stake in shares of Balchem in the 1st quarter valued at approximately $34,000. Gyon Technologies Capital Management LP acquired a new stake in shares of Balchem in the 4th quarter valued at approximately $56,000. Point72 Hong Kong Ltd acquired a new stake in shares of Balchem in the 1st quarter valued at approximately $67,000. Dark Forest Capital Management LP acquired a new stake in shares of Balchem in the 1st quarter valued at approximately $78,000. Finally, Point72 Middle East FZE acquired a new stake in shares of Balchem in the 4th quarter valued at approximately $84,000. 87.91% of the stock is owned by institutional investors. Balchem Stock Up 0.6 % NASDAQ:BCPC opened at $150.35 on Friday. The firm’s 50 day simple moving average is $128.36 and its 200 day simple moving average is $130.75. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.39, a current ratio of 3.16 and a quick ratio of 2.08. Balchem Co. has a one year low of $110.74 and a one year high of $150.82. The company has a market cap of $4.85 billion, a PE ratio of 47.13, a P/E/G ratio of 5.44 and a beta of 0.69. NASDAQ:BCPC – Get Free Report ) last posted its earnings results on Friday, October 27th. The basic materials company reported $0.90 EPS for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate of $0.91 by ($0.01). Balchem had a return on equity of 10.48% and a net margin of 11.15%. The business had revenue of $229.95 million for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $238.47 million. On average, research analysts anticipate that Balchem Co. will post 3.41 earnings per share for the current year. Balchem Increases Dividend The company also recently declared an annual dividend, which will be paid on Friday, January 19th. Shareholders of record on Wednesday, December 27th will be issued a dividend of $0.79 per share. This is a positive change from Balchem’s previous annual dividend of $0.40. The ex-dividend date is Tuesday, December 26th. This represents a yield of 0.6%. Balchem’s dividend payout ratio (DPR) is presently 24.76%. Analysts Set New Price Targets A number of research firms have recently weighed in on BCPC. HC Wainwright reduced their price target on shares of Balchem from $165.00 to $135.00 and set a “buy” rating on the stock in a research note on Monday, October 30th. StockNews.com assumed coverage on shares of Balchem in a research report on Thursday, October 5th. They set a “hold” rating on the stock. View Our Latest Stock Analysis on Balchem Balchem Company Profile Balchem Corporation develops, manufactures, and markets specialty performance ingredients and products for the nutritional, food, pharmaceutical, animal health, medical device sterilization, plant nutrition, and industrial markets in the United States and internationally. It operates through three segments: Human Nutrition and Health, Animal Nutrition and Health, and Specialty Products.
